content:
# Factorio Agent Report (Updated)

## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Electricity Generator at position (-9.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, -0.5)
- Boiler at (-6.0, 1.5) (contains 2 coal)
- Steam engine at (-1.5, 4.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED)
- Connected with pipes at (-8.5, -0.5), (-6.5, -0.5), (-7.5, -0.5)

### Iron Production Facility at position (15.5, 70.5)
Consists of:
- Electric mining drill at (15.5, 70.5) extracting iron ore (status: NO_POWER)
- Wooden chest at (15.5, 72.5) containing 39 iron ore
- Inserter at (16.5, 72.5) (status: NO_POWER)
- Stone furnace at (18.0, 73.0) (status: WORKING, contains 37 coal, producing iron plates)
- Assembling machine 2 at (20.5, 73.5) set to produce iron gear wheels (status: NO_POWER)
- Small electric poles throughout the area (voltage: 0)

## ERROR TIPS

### Persistent power connection issues
- Steam engine remains unconnected despite power backbone creation (verify pipe connections)
- Multiple entities (mining drill, inserter, assembler) still show NO_POWER status
- When placing power poles, ensure they form a continuous network connecting all devices

### Entity placement distance errors (recurring)
- Must move within 10 tiles of target position before placing entities (occurred 4 times total)
- Verify player position before attempting to place distant entities

### Inserter placement and operation issues
- Output inserter placement failed due to blocked position (clear area first)
- Inserter rotation doesn't resolve NO_POWER status (fix power connection first)
- Ensure inserter pickup/drop positions align with source/destination inventories

### List attribute access errors
- When working with lists of entities, access individual elements before using position attributes
- Verify object types before attempting connection operations

### Power pole placement conflicts
- Attempted to place power pole where one already exists (remove existing pole first)
- When rebuilding power networks, first scan area for existing poles

### Assembler input issues
- Assembler cannot produce gears due to missing iron plates (connect furnace output)
- Verify assembler has both power and input materials before production checks

### Fluid system warnings
- Steam engine shows "no input liquid" warning (verify pipe connections from boiler)
- Check fluid box connections between boiler and steam engine
